title: Covid-19: Everything Malaysians Need To Know About Travelling To Thailand
author: Lainey Loh
description: Thailand is reopening to allow fully vaccinated foreign travellers from the approved countries to enter the country by air with no quarantine requirements
cleaned_text: Your guide to travelling to the Land of Smiles as restrictions have now been officially eased [Fully vaccinated](https://www.tatlerasia.com/style/wellness/covid-19-vaccine-vaccination-malaysians-abroad) visitors from Malaysia can now forego the 14-day mandatory quarantine when entering [Thailand](https://www.tatlerasia.com/culture/travel/thailand-quarantine-free-travel-countries-list), effective Nov 1, 2021. [Malaysia](https://www.tatlerasia.com/culture/travel/best-beaches-in-malaysia-to-visit-holiday-cherating-datai-langkawi-pangkor) has been categorised alongside other Asia-Pacific countries and territories such as Australia, Brunei Darussalam, Bhutan, Cambodia, China, Hong Kong, Japan, New Zealand, Singapore, South Korea, and more in the list of low-risk countries. The list was issued by Thailand Foreign Ministry permanent secretary Thani Thongphakdi. Read more: [Penang & 3 Other Best Asian Islands For A Happy Retirement In 2021](https://www.tatlerasia.com/culture/travel/retirement-travel-penang-malaysia-bali-indonesia-koh-samui-thailand-phu-quoc-vietnam) Before you pack your bags, here's everything you need to know about travelling to the Land of Smiles: Mode of travel Under this new plan, quarantine-free travel to Thailand applies to [fully vaccinated](https://www.tatlerasia.com/style/wellness/covid-19-vaccine-malaysia-vaccination-programme-sinovac-pfizer-cansino-fmco) foreign travellers entering Thailand by air only (for now).
